results.title: Arapaho National Forest Boundary Adjustment Act of 2017
results.short_title: Arapaho National Forest Boundary Adjustment Act of 2017
results.committees: Senate Energy and Natural Resources Committee
results.latest_major_action: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 70.
results.summary: (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The expanded summary of the House passed version is repeated here.) Arapaho National Forest Boundary Adjustment Act of 2017  (Sec. 2) This bill adjusts the boundary of the Arapaho National Forest in Colorado to incorporate approximately 92.95 acres of land. The Department of Agriculture shall include all federal land within the boundary in the Bowen Gulch Protection Area established under the Colorado Wilderness Act of 1993.
results.summary_short: (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The expanded summary of the House passed version is repeated here.) Arapaho National Forest Boundary Adjustment Act of 2017  (Sec. 2) This bill adjusts the boundary of the Arapaho National Forest in Colorado to incorporate approximately 92.95 acres of land. The Department of Agriculture shall include all federal land within the boundary in the Bowen Gulch Protection Area established under the Colorado Wilderness Act of 1993.

actions.description: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 70.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Murkowski without amendment. With written report No. 115-57.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H983)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 688.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H983-984)
Mr. Lamborn moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
